titleStmt.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1865 Nov. 5

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1865 Nov. 5

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I wrote you on the 1st the morning after my arrival here Athearn left on the 2nd for Memphis and I disend him to Express to you $331 the amount of fees he had made during my absence I have made $20 per day since my return and hope to continue for some time I wish you would send me a photograph of My Mother if you can find them. I sent mine of C to Alice Merton by a gentleman from their neighborhood who promised to deliver them. I send you a card of a man in St Louis who will send you such medicine as you may want by mail we had front last night for the first time the place is quite healthy S. hopes you are getting along comfortably I have but little to write about I want to see you all very much kiss the children
